story.title: Chicago Public Schools Budget Tele-Townhall - July 18, 2012
story.description: On Wednesday July 18, 2012 Chicago Public Schools held a tele-townhall conference call to answer questions regarding the proposed FY 2013 CPS budget. 6:00 pm - 7:00 pm.

author.name: Josh Kalov
author.bio: Fan of education, politics, better government, open source software, sports, & most things peanut butter related.

data.text: More information about the FY 2013 proposed budget is available at cps.edu/budget :

link.title: Pages - FY13ProposedBudget
link.description: I'm pleased to present a budget for Fiscal Year 2013 that addresses our financial challenges, while also upholding our commitment to stud...

meta.description: I'm pleased to present a budget for Fiscal Year 2013 that addresses our financial challenges, while also upholding our commitment to students and their academic achievement. We're cutting administrative waste and inefficiencies in order to protect investments in programs that boost student learning such as full school day, early childhood development and maintaining class size, while at the same time expanding high quality school options across the district to give parents more choices.
meta.title: Pages - FY13ProposedBudget

data.text: The official Chicago Public Schools Press Release regarding the Budget Tele-Townhall:

link.title: Chicago Public Schools : Chicago Public Schools To Host First-Ever FY 13 Budget Tele-Townhall Wednesday, July 18
link.description: July 17, 2012 Chicago Public Schools (CPS) today reminded the public that it will host its first ever FY 13 budget tele-townhall on Wedne...

meta.description: July 17, 2012 Chicago Public Schools (CPS) today reminded the public that it will host its first ever FY 13 budget tele-townhall on Wednesday, July 18, from 6:00 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. The tele-townhall will provide an additional opportunity for parents, teachers and community stakeholders to learn about and comment on the District's proposed budget.
meta.title: Chicago Public Schools : Chicago Public Schools To Host First-Ever FY 13 Budget Tele-Townhall Wednesday, July 18

quote.text: Questions about the proposed #CPS budget? We're holding a Budget Tele-TownHall 6–7:30pm tomorrow (7/18). To join: 888-886-6603, then 19457#.

meta.text: Questions about the proposed #CPS budget? We're holding a Budget Tele-TownHall 6–7:30pm tomorrow (7/18). To join: 888-886-6603, then 19457#.

quote.text: The #CPS Budget TeleTownhall conference call starting now #cps

meta.text: The #CPS Budget TeleTownhall conference call starting now #cps

data.text: While there were several people on the call, most questions were answered by Chicago Public Schools Chief Administrative Officer Tim Cawley.

quote.text: "Optimize the resources that we have" "Revenues declining for 2 years in a row...big change from the past." #cps

meta.text: "Optimize the resources that we have" "Revenues declining for 2 years in a row...big change from the past." #cps

quote.text: "Full school day is clearly a significant investment for us." #cps

meta.text: "Full school day is clearly a significant investment for us." #cps

quote.text: "Trying to empower our principals/school leaders to make decisions." #cps

meta.text: "Trying to empower our principals/school leaders to make decisions." #cps

quote.text: "We are increasing school options." - He mentions charters, magnets, STEM, etc. #cps

meta.text: "We are increasing school options." - He mentions charters, magnets, STEM, etc. #cps

quote.text: @shua123 #cps By doing what? Cutting services and NOT raising building based funding

meta.text: @shua123 #cps By doing what? Cutting services and NOT raising building based funding

quote.text: "We've been bailed out by one time fixes" over past couple years. #cps

meta.text: "We've been bailed out by one time fixes" over past couple years. #cps

quote.text: "Cuts done as far away from classroom as possible."...Then he mentions facility management as being something cut... #cps

meta.text: "Cuts done as far away from classroom as possible."...Then he mentions facility management as being something cut... #cps

quote.text: "I can't imagine how we could have enacted another couple hundred million in cuts just so we could sit on reserves money." #cps

meta.text: "I can't imagine how we could have enacted another couple hundred million in cuts just so we could sit on reserves money." #cps

quote.text: @shua123 I can't imagine how they can add $76 million in charter funding to deplete the reserves. Or more millions more on portfolio offce

meta.text: @shua123 I can't imagine how they can add $76 million in charter funding to deplete the reserves. Or more millions more on portfolio offce

quote.text: Significant drop in capital budget. Spending money adding science labs, playgrounds, etc. Capital Plan: http://j.mp/Ob4cp9 #cps

meta.text: Significant drop in capital budget. Spending money adding science labs, playgrounds, etc. Capital Plan: http://t.co/Mg0xWnIm #cps

quote.text: "Number 1 priority is to improve outcomes for students." #cps

meta.text: "Number 1 priority is to improve outcomes for students." #cps

quote.text: "It is impossible to make everyone happy but hopefully we are making the right decisions that improve outcomes for students" #cps

meta.text: "It is impossible to make everyone happy but hopefully we are making the right decisions that improve outcomes for students" #cps

quote.text: Time for questions #cps

meta.text: Time for questions #cps

quote.text: Q: How can CPS afford longer school day? #cps

meta.text: Q: How can CPS afford longer school day? #cps

quote.text: I don't think they can... RT @shua123: Q: How can CPS afford longer school day? #cps

meta.text: I don't think they can... RT @shua123: Q: How can CPS afford longer school day? #cps

quote.text: A: Any decision we make on extending school day (or anything else) is that it is a high priority. #cps

meta.text: A: Any decision we make on extending school day (or anything else) is that it is a high priority. #cps

quote.text: A: Currently at state minimum for school day/year. "We don't think that is enough time." #cps

meta.text: A: Currently at state minimum for school day/year. "We don't think that is enough time." #cps

quote.text: A: We looked at our resources and asked where we can spend less money in order to reinvest money in longer day. #cps

meta.text: A: We looked at our resources and asked where we can spend less money in order to reinvest money in longer day. #cps

quote.text: A: We wish we had a lot more revenue, but we have to make the best decisions with the money we have. #cps

meta.text: A: We wish we had a lot more revenue, but we have to make the best decisions with the money we have. #cps

quote.text: Q: Why does board insist on expanding charters? #cps

meta.text: Q: Why does board insist on expanding charters? #cps

quote.text: A: CPS is committed to diverse set of options. Charters schools are part of mix. Thousands of students on waiting lists. #cps

meta.text: A: CPS is committed to diverse set of options. Charters schools are part of mix. Thousands of students on waiting lists. #cps

quote.text: A: We care that they are high performing. Important to ensure that charters continue to be high quality & have rigorous standar #cps

meta.text: A: We care that they are high performing. Important to ensure that charters continue to be high quality & have rigorous standar #cps

quote.text: A: "We are dead serious about closing charters that aren't performing" #cps

meta.text: A: "We are dead serious about closing charters that aren't performing" #cps

quote.text: Q about raises. A: Budgeted 2% across board for all CPS employees. #cps

meta.text: Q about raises. A: Budgeted 2% across board for all CPS employees. #cps

quote.text: Q: Why cut Culture of Calm program? A: Not cutting, some money from central office, some money from Principals discretionary #cps

meta.text: Q: Why cut Culture of Calm program? A: Not cutting, some money from central office, some money from Principals discretionary #cps

quote.text: Q: How will budget cuts impact safety inside schools? A: "We will not compromise safety aspects in our schools." #cps

meta.text: Q: How will budget cuts impact safety inside schools? A: "We will not compromise safety aspects in our schools." #cps

quote.text: Q: What is avg teacher salary in CPS, how does it compare to NY and LA? A: CPS avg. just over $76,000 + benefits. #cps

meta.text: Q: What is avg teacher salary in CPS, how does it compare to NY and LA? A: CPS avg. just over $76,000 + benefits. #cps

quote.text: A: CPS highest. NY is closest. Comparisons made to different levels of experience. #cps

meta.text: A: CPS highest. NY is closest. Comparisons made to different levels of experience. #cps

quote.text: Answer about restorative justice.. CPS moving more towards restorative justice. #cps

meta.text: Answer about restorative justice.. CPS moving more towards restorative justice. #cps

quote.text: Q: Is it possible to get input from community members during budget process? A:Community hearings last week, this call. #cps

meta.text: Q: Is it possible to get input from community members during budget process? A:Community hearings last week, this call. #cps

quote.text: A: We are always open to ideas that people have for how to do things differently. Especially creative solutions. #cps

meta.text: A: We are always open to ideas that people have for how to do things differently. Especially creative solutions. #cps

quote.text: A: Board just started process of office hours where community can come in to talk about budget priorities. #cps

meta.text: A: Board just started process of office hours where community can come in to talk about budget priorities. #cps

quote.text: Tim Cawley has been answering most of these questions. #cps

meta.text: Tim Cawley has been answering most of these questions. #cps

quote.text: It seems like they ran out of questions.... #cps

meta.text: It seems like they ran out of questions.... #cps

data.text: They took a couple minute break while waiting for more questions to come in...

quote.text: Q: Does a longer school day have to be 7 hours? Is it negotiable? #cps

meta.text: Q: Does a longer school day have to be 7 hours? Is it negotiable? #cps

quote.text: A: No it is not negotiable. Believe it will pay dividends for students. We want to give 7 hours a shot. Arts, music,recess #cps

meta.text: A: No it is not negotiable. Believe it will pay dividends for students. We want to give 7 hours a shot. Arts, music,recess #cps

quote.text: A: We are a learning organization, changes in the future based on how it goes. #cps

meta.text: A: We are a learning organization, changes in the future based on how it goes. #cps

quote.text: @shua123 #cps how about research supported solutions :)

meta.text: @shua123 #cps how about research supported solutions :)

quote.text: Q: What does discretionary funding mean? A: More money for schools/LSC to make decisions. Many use for tchrs. Adding full time art,etc #cps

meta.text: Q: What does discretionary funding mean? A: More money for schools/LSC to make decisions. Many use for tchrs. Adding full time art,etc #cps

quote.text: @shua123 #cps This looks false according to the budget at the vast majority of neighborhood schools

meta.text: @shua123 #cps This looks false according to the budget at the vast majority of neighborhood schools

quote.text: Q: Are there further reserves or plans to raise revenue? A: No. We have to come up with a plan to rethink district finances for future. #cps

meta.text: Q: Are there further reserves or plans to raise revenue? A: No. We have to come up with a plan to rethink district finances for future. #cps

quote.text: A: Significant effort in Springfield for more support for education. #cps

meta.text: A: Significant effort in Springfield for more support for education. #cps

quote.text: A: Looking at selling vacant lots, empty buildings for some revenue. #cps

meta.text: A: Looking at selling vacant lots, empty buildings for some revenue. #cps

quote.text: Q: Is this the largest deficit that CPS has ever faced? A: now-no. But yes in 2014 with increase in pension obligation #cps

meta.text: Q: Is this the largest deficit that CPS has ever faced? A: now-no. But yes in 2014 with increase in pension obligation #cps

quote.text: Q: Did you prep the principals for increase in discretionary funding? A: Tim: "I think we did a good job of that this year." #cps

meta.text: Q: Did you prep the principals for increase in discretionary funding? A: Tim: "I think we did a good job of that this year." #cps

quote.text: A: Met with groups of principals. 19 total meetings. Explaining changes in budget, discretionary fund, longer day, etc. #cps

meta.text: A: Met with groups of principals. 19 total meetings. Explaining changes in budget, discretionary fund, longer day, etc. #cps

quote.text: Q: If deficit is going to be worse in the future, what is CPS doing to fix it? A: Pension reform, reduction in captial funds. #cps

meta.text: Q: If deficit is going to be worse in the future, what is CPS doing to fix it? A: Pension reform, reduction in captial funds. #cps

quote.text: @shua123 #cps pension reform actually exacerbated the prob--if they had made payments instead of #ids, it wouldn't be much of a prob

meta.text: @shua123 #cps pension reform actually exacerbated the prob--if they had made payments instead of #ids, it wouldn't be much of a prob

quote.text: A: Adding air condtioning to all schools would cost ~$300+ million. $150 million for Track E schools. #cps

meta.text: A: Adding air condtioning to all schools would cost ~$300+ million. $150 million for Track E schools. #cps

quote.text: WORTH IT! RT @shua123: A: Adding air condtioning to all schools would cost ~$300+ million. $150 million for Track E schools. #cps

meta.text: WORTH IT! RT @shua123: A: Adding air condtioning to all schools would cost ~$300+ million. $150 million for Track E schools. #cps

quote.text: A: We have to accomplish our goals with 20% less funds than we had before. #cps

meta.text: A: We have to accomplish our goals with 20% less funds than we had before. #cps

quote.text: Q: Is CPS willing to ask employees to pay for more of their medical costs? A: Rather not comment as it is part of labor negotiations. #cps

meta.text: Q: Is CPS willing to ask employees to pay for more of their medical costs? A: Rather not comment as it is part of labor negotiations. #cps

quote.text: A: Adding wellness programs to reduce long term healthcare costs. #cps

meta.text: A: Adding wellness programs to reduce long term healthcare costs. #cps

quote.text: A: Healthcare burden is disproportionately on single employees. #cps

meta.text: A: Healthcare burden is disproportionately on single employees. #cps

quote.text: Q: Class size, expanding, staying the same? A: In this budget made commitment to maintain class size. #cps

meta.text: Q: Class size, expanding, staying the same? A: In this budget made commitment to maintain class size. #cps

quote.text: A: Can't promise in future re class size. Huge cost increase for smaller class size. Reserves used to maintain current size. #cps

meta.text: A: Can't promise in future re class size. Huge cost increase for smaller class size. Reserves used to maintain current size. #cps

quote.text: @shua123 that's all in the framing. We can say reserves used to fund network offcs, portfolio dept, charters, magnets, etc.

meta.text: @shua123 that's all in the framing. We can say reserves used to fund network offcs, portfolio dept, charters, magnets, etc.

quote.text: @ILRaiseYourHand true... Underlying point is the same though. There is not enough $ available to do everything everyone wants.

meta.text: @ILRaiseYourHand true... Underlying point is the same though. There is not enough $ available to do everything everyone wants.

quote.text: A: Work hard to keep cuts away from the classroom. #cps

meta.text: A: Work hard to keep cuts away from the classroom. #cps

quote.text: The last couple questions came from the feedback form on cps's budget page. #cps

meta.text: The last couple questions came from the feedback form on cps's budget page. #cps

quote.text: Townhall has ended. #cps

meta.text: Townhall has ended. #cps
